client_id.description: The client ID for authenticating with the Formance Cloud API. Can also be set via the FORMANCE_CLOUD_CLIENT_ID environment variable.

client_secret.description: The client secret for authenticating with the Formance Cloud API. Can also be set via the FORMANCE_CLOUD_CLIENT_SECRET environment variable.

endpoint.description: The endpoint URL for the Formance Cloud API. Defaults to the production endpoint. Can also be set via the FORMANCE_CLOUD_API_ENDPOINT environment variable.

block.description: The Formance Cloud provider allows you to manage your Formance Cloud resources using Terraform. It provides resources for managing stacks and stack modules.
A no-operation resource for testing purposes. This resource performs no actual operations and exists solely for provider testing and validation.

email.description: The email address of the user to invite or add to the organization.

id.description: The unique identifier of the invitation or membership.

role.description: The role to assign to the user in the organization. Valid values are: GUEST, ADMIN.

user_id.description: The user ID once the invitation has been accepted.

block.description: Manages organization members and invitations in Formance Cloud. This resource can be used to invite users to an organization and manage their access levels.

force_destroy.description: When set to true, the stack will be forcefully deleted even if it contains data. Use with caution.

id.description: The unique identifier of the stack.

name.description: The name of the stack. Must be unique within the organization.

region_id.description: The region ID where the stack will be deployed.

uri.description: The URI of the deployed stack.

version.description: The version of Formance to deploy. If not specified, the latest version will be used.

block.description: Manages a Formance Cloud stack. A stack is an isolated environment where you can deploy and run Formance services.

role.description: The role to assign to the user for this stack. Valid values are: GUEST, ADMIN.

stack_id.description: The ID of the stack where the user will be granted access.

user_id.description: The ID of the user to grant access to the stack. The user must already be a member of the organization.

block.description: Manages stack members and their access levels in Formance Cloud. This resource allows you to grant users access to specific stacks within an organization.

name.description: The name of the module to enable. Valid module names include: ledger, payments, webhooks, wallets, search, reconciliation, orchestration, auth, stargate.

stack_id.description: The ID of the stack where the module will be enabled.

block.description: Manages modules within a Formance Cloud stack. Modules are individual services that can be enabled or disabled on a stack.

id.description: The unique identifier of the organization.

owner_id.description: The ID of the organization owner.

block.description: Retrieves information about the current/first organization associated with the authenticated user.

id.description: The unique identifier of the region. If not specified, uses the first available region sorted deterministically by ID.

versions.description: The list of available Formance versions in the region.

block.description: Retrieves the list of available Formance versions for a region. If id is specified, uses that region. Otherwise, uses the first available region sorted deterministically by ID.

id.description: The unique identifier of the region.

name.description: The name of the region to retrieve. If not specified, returns the first available region sorted deterministically by ID.

block.description: Retrieves information about regions within an organization. If name is specified, returns a specific region by name. Otherwise, returns the first available region sorted deterministically by ID.

id.description: The unique identifier of the stack. If not specified, returns the first available stack sorted alphabetically by name.

region_id.description: The region ID where the stack is installed.

state.description: The current state of the stack.

status.description: The current status of the stack.

block.description: Retrieves information about a Formance Cloud stack. If id is specified, returns a specific stack by ID. Otherwise, returns the first available stack sorted alphabetically by name for predictable behavior.
